Title: Object: Nocturna Hospitatio
Series: Vita S. Ioseph B.mae Virginis Sponsi Patriarcharum Maximi
Description: Rest on the flight into Egypt; dilapidated barnhouse interior; the Virgin is seated suckling the infant Christ in the foreground; behind St Joseph feeds his donkey and ox; another farm building in the background Engraving and etching
Curator's comments: This is one from a series of twenty-eight unnumbered scenes relating to the life of St Joseph, for comment see 1972,U.6.1.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (undescribed)
Associated names: Associated with: Hendrik van der Gracht (author of Latin verses)
Acquisition notes: Stamped in black ink, in octagon: 'MVSEVM / BRITAN / NICVM' (L.296). Transferred from the British Library; inscribed in graphite on a flyleaf: "c-72 / 7".
